content:
1. Early adolescence is a time of significant change in family relationships; however, characterising adolescence as a period of inevitable family conflict is incorrect.
2. Animal advocates contend that keeping wildlife captive cannot be justified unless the benefits of zoos are significant.
3. Communicative development in the first year of all infants follows the same process, regardless of the complexity of the language being acquired.
4. While neuroscientists have a good understanding of how individual neurons operate, they have limited knowledge of how large numbers of neurons work together to produce thoughts, feelings and behaviours.
